intro: Relbunium hypocarpium var. incanum, commonly known as the white-haired sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It is often found in sandy or gravelly habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native environment. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
